metadata.dc:title: Atypical Cogan´s syndrome
metadata.dc:description: Cogan’s syndrome is a rare clinical entity of an autoimmuneorigin,characterised by ocular and audiovestibularmanifestations with systemic implications. It isclinically presented in two ways: typical and atypical;being incorrectly diagnosed most of the times, due tounspecific initial group of symptoms, and most of all, tothe absence of communication between ophthalmologistsand ENT doctors, because none of them looks into otherorgans symptoms. We describe two cases and we carryout a revision of Cogan's syndrome so that incorrect diagnosisdoes not occur
